Module Basics
Package basics.math.rot

Class RotoTranslationMatrix

java.lang.Object
basics.math.rot.RotoTranslation
basics.math.rot.RotoTranslationMatrix
public class RotoTranslationMatrix
extends RotoTranslation
An object that encapsulates a rotation and translation. The rotation is based on a rotation matrix.
Author:
Jörg Roth (Joerg.Roth@Wireless-earth.org)

  • Field Summary

    Fields 
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    protected double[][] rotation

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors 
    Constructor Description
    RotoTranslationMatrix()
    Create a roto-translation without any effect, i.e. null rotation and null translation.

    Create a roto-translation with null rotation and only translation.

    RotoTranslationMatrix​(RotoTranslation rt1, RotoTranslation rt2)

  • Constructor Details

    • RotoTranslationMatrix

      public RotoTranslationMatrix()
      Create a roto-translation without any effect, i.e. null rotation and null translation.

    • RotoTranslationMatrix

      public RotoTranslationMatrix​(double[] translation)
      Create a roto-translation with null rotation and only translation.
      Parameters:
      translation - translation vector (3)

    • RotoTranslationMatrix

      public RotoTranslationMatrix​(double[][] rotation, double[] translation)
      Create a roto-translation.
      Parameters:
      rotation - rotation matrix (3 x 3)
      translation - translation vector (3)

    • RotoTranslationMatrix

      public RotoTranslationMatrix​(RotoTranslation rotoTranslation)
      Copying constructor - all internal structures are deeply copied. If the given roto-translation is of another type (e.g. RotoTranslationQuaternion), the structure first is converted.
      Parameters:
      rotoTranslation - roto-translation to be copied

    • RotoTranslationMatrix

      public RotoTranslationMatrix​(double movX, double movY, double movZ, double angYZ, double angXZ, double angXY)
      Create a roto-translation.
      Parameters:
      movX - the translation in x-direction
      movY - the translation in y-direction
      movZ - the translation in z-direction
      angYZ - rotation angle in radians in the y-z-plane
      angXZ - rotation angle in radians in the x-z-plane
      angXY - rotation angle in radians in the x-y-plane

    • RotoTranslationMatrix

      public RotoTranslationMatrix​(RotoTranslation rt1, RotoTranslation rt2)
      Create a total roto-translation of two separate roto-translations.
      Parameters:
      rt1 - first roto-translation to be applied
      rt2 - second roto-translation to be applied

  • Method Details

    • fromReverseEulerAngles

      public static RotoTranslationMatrix fromReverseEulerAngles​(double movX, double movY, double movZ, double angYZ, double angXZ, double angXY)
      Create a roto-translation. The angles are appied in reverse order (i.e. ordering y-z-plane – x-z-plane – x-y-plane).
      Parameters:
      movX - the translation in x-direction
      movY - the translation in y-direction
      movZ - the translation in z-direction
      angYZ - rotation angle in radians in the y-z-plane
      angXZ - rotation angle in radians in the x-z-plane
      angXY - rotation angle in radians in the x-y-plane
      Returns:
      roto-translation

    • inverse

      public RotoTranslation inverse()
      Description copied from class: RotoTranslation
      Creates a roto-translation that represents the inverse mapping. This means, after 
       double[] y=rt.rotoTranslate(x);
 double[] x2=rt.inverse().rotoTranslate(y);
      x and y are practically equal.
      Specified by:
      inverse in class RotoTranslation
      Returns:
      the inverse

    • rotoTranslateInverse

      public double[] rotoTranslateInverse​(double[] point)
      Description copied from class: RotoTranslation
      Roto-translate a point with inverse function. This means, after 
       double[] x=...
 double[] y=rt.rotoTranslateInverse(rt.rotoTranslate(x));
      x and y are practically equal.
      Specified by:
      rotoTranslateInverse in class RotoTranslation
      Parameters:
      point - point
      Returns:
      inverse roto-translated point

    • rotateInverse

      public double[] rotateInverse​(double[] point)
      Description copied from class: RotoTranslation
      Rotate a point with inverse function (i.e. only apply inverse rotation, ignore translation). This means, after 
       double[] x=...
 double[] y=rt.rotateInverse(rt.rotate(x));
      x and y are practically equal.
      Specified by:
      rotateInverse in class RotoTranslation
      Parameters:
      point - point
      Returns:
      inverse rotated point

    • getEulerAngles

      public double[] getEulerAngles()
      Description copied from class: RotoTranslation
      Get the rotation angles, if the rotation is applied in the ordering x-y-plane – x-z-plane – y-z-plane.
      Specified by:
      getEulerAngles in class RotoTranslation
      Returns:
      array of three angles with [0]: angYZ rotation angle in radians in the y-z-plane, [1]: angXZ rotation angle in radians in the x-z-plane [2]: angXY rotation angle in radians in the x-y-plane,

    • getEulerAnglesReverse

      public double[] getEulerAnglesReverse()
      Description copied from class: RotoTranslation
      Get the rotation angles in reverse order (compared to RotoTranslation.getEulerAngles()), i.e. if the rotation is applied in the ordering y-z-plane – x-z-plane – x-y-plane.
      Specified by:
      getEulerAnglesReverse in class RotoTranslation
      Returns:
      array of three angles with [0]: angYZ rotation angle in radians in the y-z-plane, [1]: angXZ rotation angle in radians in the x-z-plane [2]: angXY rotation angle in radians in the x-y-plane,
